title.value: Causal machine learning for single-cell genomics
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as specified in the provided text.
title.quote: Causal machine learning for single-cell genomics

extractions.description: This paper explores the application of causal machine learning techniques to single-cell genomics. It delves into the challenges and methodologies for applying causal approaches to understand gene regulation, disease progression, and cellular development from a causal perspective. It also identifies open problems such as generalizing to unseen environments, learning interpretable models, and modeling the dynamics of biological mechanisms.

type.justification: The paper discusses specific methodologies, presents analyses and experiments, and refers to empirical data and case studies in single-cell genomics.
type.quote: In this perspective, we delineate the application of these methodologies within the realm of single-cell genomics and their challenges. We first present the model that underlies most of current causal approaches to single-cell biology...

name.justification: The primary research focus is on the intersection of causal machine learning and genomics, particularly looking at single-cell genomics.
name.quote: Advances in single-cell omics allow for unprecedented insights into the transcription profiles of individual cells.

name.justification: The paper focuses heavily on the causal machine learning models and methodologies applied to genomics.
name.quote: Within the machine learning community, there has been a recent increase of interest in causality, with a focus on adapting established causal techniques and algorithms to handle high-dimensional data.

name.justification: The paper addresses biological mechanisms, gene regulation, and cellular development from a biological viewpoint.
name.quote: ...opportunity to better understand the causative role of genes in complex biological processes such as gene regulation, disease progression or cellular development.

name.justification: The paper frequently references SCM as a core model applied to single-cell genomics.
name.quote: For instance the recent resurgence of interest in causal machine learning has proposed adapting frameworks such as Structural Causal Models (SCM) to high dimensional data, thereby opening the way to applications of these methods in transcriptomics.

is_contributed.justification: SCM is an established model and not introduced by this paper.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not specify whether SCMs are executed on GPU or CPU.
is_executed.quote: No explicit mention of GPU or CPU execution

is_compared.justification: The paper does not provide numerical comparisons of SCM against other models.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference for SCM is given in the paper's background section.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Pearl, J. Causality: models, reasoning, and inference.

name.justification: The paper mentions DSCM as a variant of SCM tailored to capture the temporal changes in causal relationships.
name.quote: In causal kinetic models introduced by Peters et al.36, structural assignments govern the rate of change of causal variables by relying on ordinary differential equations (ODE) and stochastic differential equations (SDE).

is_contributed.justification: DSCM is based on earlier work and is not introduced by this paper.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not specify whether DSCMs are executed on GPU or CPU.
is_executed.quote: No explicit mention of GPU or CPU execution

is_compared.justification: The paper does not provide numerical comparisons of DSCM against other models.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference for DSCM is given in the cited paper's background section.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Peters, J., Bauer, S. & Pfister, N. Causal models for dynamical systems.

name.justification: The provided text often references the use of single-cell RNA sequencing data in the context of single-cell genomics.
name.quote: ...extensive use of bioinformatic analysis tools. For all methods mentioned above, the experimental validation of the inferred GRNs has been a huge challenge28. Indeed, the true GRN is mostly unknown in the case of human cells. Other organisms, s.a. E. Coli are better understood, and regulation databases exist100, but they are still noisy and incomplete.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references the dataset but does not specify a particular titled work as its source.

name.justification: The paper references GFlowNets as a tool used within the domain of causality and machine learning in genomics.
name.quote: Jain, M. et al. GFlowNets for AI-Driven Scientific Discovery. Preprint at https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2302.00615 (2023).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference for GFlowNets is given in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Jain, M. et al. GFlowNets for AI-Driven Scientific Discovery. Preprint at https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2302.00615 (2023).
